events.name: Innovati50n reconstructed @ ArtScience museum
events.description:
Innovati50n reconstructed @ ArtScience museum
An Interlude of Science meets Art by A*STAR & NAFA
(Workshops and ‘pop up’ talks throughout the day)
Saturday and Sunday, 5 & 6 December
10am - 7pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

The Agency of Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) & the Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA) have created 17 science-inspired exhibits using an array of artistic techniques such as fine art, digital art, photography, sculpture and others. Meet the scientists and artists behind this creative showcase of Singapore’s scientific innovations and get hands-on with our unique Science-Art workshops and demos.

Workshops:
The workshops will be held in the reception area of Level 4 where the event is held. Take your pick of 4 unique and creative interactions led by A*STAR scientists and NAFA talents. Participation is on a first-come-first-served basis. Registration and workshop details will be provided at the Innovati50n reception counter on the days of the event.

Workshop choices include:
• Creativity through Science 
• Making colourful fine art on a nanoscale 
• 'Glow art’ inspired by Liquid Forging
• Crochet Art in Sculpture 

Workshop timings are
Saturday and Sunday, 5 - 6 December
2:00pm - 2:45pm
3:00pm - 3:45pm
4:00pm - 4:45pm
5:00pm - 5:45pm

Pop-Up’ Talks: 
Conversations with the leading scientists behind some of Singapore’s top 50 innovations. Talks will be held in the Inspiration Room on Level 4 where the event is held. Registration and details will be provided at the Innovati50n reception counter on the days of the event.

Choice of Talks 
• Making sense of allergies
• Building better baby’s brains
• Can mother’s milk speak to the baby 

Talk timings:
Saturday, 5 December 
2:00pm - 2:30pm
2:45pm - 3:15pm
3:30pm - 4:00pm
4:15pm - 4:45pm
5:00pm - 5:30pm
5:45pm - 6:15pm

About Sunday Showcases:  
#SundayShowcase events allow visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday (and sometime Saturday too) each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series.

events.name: Last 2015 Drone Fun FPV Meetup!
events.description:
2015 has been a great year for FPV, and this will be our last meetup before 2016. Location: nr Holland Village - nice trees, good space for acro/racing/cruising - my last video from this location: One Pack Afterwards there are restaurants and bars nearby too for anyone who fancies a post-flight (or post-crash!) beer or two! 


N.B. Weather permitting!  This time of year is a high risk of rain in the afternoon, please check the weather forecast on the day! 


As always, the following rules apply: 1) Don't switch on your VTx without pre-announcing it to fliers currently in the air and waiting for their confirmation 2) Make sure you know your VTx frequency and are able to adjust it 3) During racing, if you're not currently racing do not switch on at all, until the current race is complete 4) Don't fly beyond your own abilities We're a friendly and encouraging group though, so even if you're a beginner we'll help you to get started. NB - This is a casual meetup and all attendees are responsible for their own safety and liability.
events.location: Holland Village FPV Space, 17 Holland Drive, Singapore
